choices.answer: only doctors
anyone who sees an injury or accident
only lawyers
only people who have certificates

questions.question: What is the first thing you should do if you see a person who is injured or sick?

choices.answer: Check to be sure they are breathing.
Give them the Heimlich maneuver.
Roll him onto his back if he is on his side
Check to be sure it is safe for you to help.

questions.question: If a woman is lying down and might be unconscious, you should

choices.answer: roll her over
give her CPR even if you aren't trained
tap her shoulder and say "Are you okay?"
ask her if she is hungry

questions.question: If she doesn't answer you should

choices.answer: call 911, tell them you have a hurt person who won't answer
call the hospital
call 911, tell them that a woman had a heart attack
call 911, tell them that a woman is choking

questions.question: If you see someone in the water who may be drowning, you should

choices.answer: jump in to save them
throw them a life preserver
stay on dry ground and find a pole that can reach them
throw anything that floats near them

questions.question: If you have a small cut, you should

choices.answer: wipe the blood off with the back of your hand
clean it and put a bandage on it
call 911
leave it alone

questions.question: If someone has a large cut that is bleeding a lot you should

choices.answer: put a clean bandage over it
apply pressure
elevate the body part with the cut
all of the above

questions.question: When is a cut bad enough to call 911?

choices.answer: when the blood is spurting out
When the bleeding does not stop in 10 minutes
when the person passes out
all of the above

questions.question: If you are inside your house and it catches on fire, what should you do?

choices.answer: call 911, then run out of your house.
Get out of the house, then call 911
run upstairs to get your wallet before you leave
all of the above

questions.question: You are in your bedroom with the door closed during a fire. What should you do before leaving?

choices.answer: Feel the door with the back of your hand.
Open the door just a little to see if you can get out.
Call 911 and ask them what to do.
Hide in the closet.

questions.question: What should you do if your clothes are on fire?

choices.answer: Take your clothes off.
Run to the nearest swimming pool and jump in.
Scream for help
Stop, drop and roll.
The person is having a stroke.
The person is having a heart attack.
The person is choking.
The person is feeling nauseous.
